article:
'System phenomena' (also known as and further noted as 'system identification'
and '[[scientific modeling|modeling]]') is the science of observing the
behaviour of a system. The classification of a dynamic system describes how
systems are grouped with certain characteristics into special classes and
identify mathematical techniques that apply to these classes of problems.

In particular most systems have five characteristics:
:#linear or nonlinear #constant or variable coefficient #forced or unforced
:#lumped or distributed parameter #deterministic or stochastic
